H0.text: Erosion is most directly responsible for building up a river delta.

H1.text: Leaching is most directly responsible for building up a river delta.

H2.text: Subsidence is most directly responsible for building up a river delta.

H3.text: Deposition is the process most directly responsible for building up a river delta.

A4.text: Deposition is the geological process in which sediments, soil and rocks are added to a landform or landmass.

A5.text: The null-point hypothesis explains how sediment is deposited throughout a shore profile according to its grain size.
